content: New issue, found out that the 3rd TEST is wrong because it is missing an empty line for lowercase characters, FIXED

EDIT:

* Modified constraints to use [[T]] && Make input character range explained clearer with the use of CONSTANTS

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: je la troube

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very easy but good for CoC.

My Code:

t = input()
d1=''
d2=''
for c in t:
    if c.isupper():d1+=c
    else:d2+=c
print(d1,d2,sep='\n')

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is short and fun, unlike a lot of the contributions I have encountered which were too complicated to the point where it was no fun.
Awesome! I love how simple it is with just a tad bit of difficulty which makes things fun :)

t = input()
print( "".join([i for i in t if i.isupper() ]) ,end="\n")
print( "".join([i for i in t if i.islower() ]) ,end="")

i was bit confused with validator 3, 
but again something has to understood with coding experience. 
so this question sounds good.
It might be helpful to specify that if there are no uppercase letters, you print an empty line.
what a nice little problem, would love to see it in a shortest code mode clash :)

I encountered the issue your code addreses when I tried implementing it in Python. Validator3 refused the extra newline, while I wished it accepted it. I changed Validator 3.

Now the following Python code works:

import re
t = input()
print("".join(re.findall(r'[A-Z]+', t)))
print("".join(re.findall(r'[a-z]+', t)))

Thank you for your comment
Yup, thank you for pointing it out, I fixed it!

Theoretically you're right, but trailing newlines are ignored by CG's referee. A player can pass that test even without printing a trailing newline (I tested that in C and Python).

Also note that "alphabets" should be "alphabet" because there's only one alphabet, not two.
